SummaryOfDirectChrtblActyGrp.Description1Txt: Data Driven Education & Ed-FiThese direct charitable activities support the delivery of modern, flexible, powerful and actionable student-centric education data systems for K-12 schools that educators can use. They also support the development of the Ed-Fi solution - the only free, flexible and complete ed-tech solution to empower educators with relevant, timely information that enables better data collection to drive higher student outcomes. These activities include funds to help stabilize, strengthen, and support state assessment and accountability amid the challenges and uncertainties created by the COVID-19 pandemic. They also support the creation and implementation of an education data system in South Africa that will advance student outcomes through district management tools and best practice sharing.
SummaryOfDirectChrtblActyGrp.Description2Txt: Global Scholarship/University SuccessThese direct charitable activities support the implementation of and improvements to global scholarship tools in the US and South Africa. They also support a robust US scholarship program application platform. Additionally, these activities provide persistence and completion support services to eligible UT Pell students.
SummaryOfDirectChrtblActyGrp.Description3Txt: Educational Initiatives K-12These direct charitable activities support pre-university education quality improvement projects in the US, India and South Africa. Additionally, they support assessments of education improvement efforts. They also include highly targeted funds to support schools as they adapt to school disruptions caused by the COVID pandemic and look ahead to future school years.
SummaryOfDirectChrtblActyGrp.Description4Txt: Jobs & LivelihoodsThese direct charitable activities support the development of market-based models in the US, India and South Africa to provide families living in urban poverty access to financial tools, skill development and employment opportunities in order to establish financial stability. Additionally, these direct charitable activities support a goal of increasing capacity in the Central Texas medical community. This category also includes a project that aims to improve the capacity of the local food system and a project which seeks to deploy a platform to more efficiently connect AISD students, parents and staff.

SumOfProgramRelatedInvstGrp.Description1Txt: Kaleidofin Private Limited - Equity investment in an Indian fin-tech company that offers savings, credit and payment products to underbanked and unbanked low income individuals, micro entrepreneurs and micro enterprises.
SumOfProgramRelatedInvstGrp.Description2Txt: Avanti Finance Pvt Ltd - Loan support to a Indian Non-Banking Financial Corporation (NBFC) that provides short-term collateral-free loans to support livelihoods of micro entrepreneurs through a digital platform. This loan seeks to reduce the economic stress of these enterprises caused by the pandemic.

RlnOfActyToAccomOfExmptPrpsGrp.RelationshipStatementTxt: Event & sponsorship fees: The Ed-Fi Alliance conducts an annual summit and bootcamp that brings together state and local education agency leaders, ed-tech vendors, technical experts and decision makers to connect, share, and learn about the advantages of data interoperability using the Ed-Fi data standard and technology tools. To help offset the costs of these events, Ed-Fi Alliance collects registration fees from attendees and sponsorship payments from organizations.

Subscription/implementation fees: College Success Tools ("CST") licenses its comprehensive, cloud-based student management Software as a Service ("SaaS") platform, GradSnapp, which empowers organizations to understand each student's journey through college and provides the support and interventions they need while saving time and budget. GradSnapp provides comprehensive student profiles, including student progress dashboards, risk indicators and more. To help offset the costs of these activities, CST collects subscription and implementation fees from licensing GradSnapp.

Interest/dividends - PRIs: The Foundation uses highly structured equity and loan investments to help select entrepreneurial organizations in education, vocational training, and financial inclusion that help socially driven entrepreneurs launch new products that open new markets to routinely provide families living in urban poverty with access to the best-in-class financial, educational, and other tools that can help them transform their lifetime prospects.

AllOtherProgramRelatedInvstGrp.Desc: American YouthWorks - Loan to provide stabilizing support during COVID 19 to a US org that provides young people with opportunities to build careers, strengthen communities, and improve the environment through education, on the job training and service to others.
Arthan Finance - Equity investment in an Indian NBFC that offers credit products such as secured and unsecured working capital loans and supply chain financing to micro and small enterprises.
BetterLesson - Loan support to and Indian entity which supports the continued growth of 1-to-1 virtual coaching for teachers to improve their instructional practice.

Bharat Inclusive Technologies Seed Holdings Limited - Equity investment in an India based "seed facility" fund that provides equity seed capital to early-state companies to improve the financial and economic lives of low income families in India.
Blowhorn - Equity investment in a Indian technology-based company that has built an online platform to help poor intra-city truck drivers find regular work via a mobile app.
Capital Good Fund - Loan to support 560 vulnerable low income black, indigenous and people of color families in financial emergency related to COVID-19.

ConveGenius International Holdings Pte. Ltd. - Equity investment in a Singpore based entity that supports a unique Indian mobile learning solutions company, focused on improving learning outcomes through gamification of education.
Digital Workforce Academy - Loan to a Texas-based entity to stabilize and scale operations to support 150 adult learners with career building and job training services.

Education Catalyst Fund - Investment support in an Indian fund that provides early stage seed funding for companies focusing on high quality education and skill training for children and youth in urban, low income households.
Kings Learning Private Limited - Equity investment in an Indian company that delivers a proven spoken English learning solution through offline, online and blended delivery channels.

LiftFund - Loan to support 250 vulnerable small businesses impacted by Covid-19 in Texas. These loans ($5,000 - $30,000) are expected to enable small business owners to resume and sustain their businesses, thereby creating or retaining up to 1,500 jobs.
NEW Apprenticeship - Equity investment in an enterprise that partners with employers to provide paid apprenticeships in IT services and digital marketing to low income students.

Pravega Ventures Trust - Partnership investment in an Indian seed fund focused on investing in early stage organizations in the product trial or pre-revenue stages of its lifecycle and catering to Indian households with incomes less than INR 40,000 per month.
Reach II, LP - Equity investment in a U.S. based private equity fund set up to make negotiated investments (private) in companies focused on issues of access and opportunity in U.S. K-12 education.
Reach, LP - Equity investment in a U.S. based private equity fund set up to make negotiated investments (private) in companies focused on issues of access and opportunity in U.S. K-12 education.
Rent Reporter Inc - Loan support to assist 3,000 vulnerable BIPOC families with low cost rental loans for those facing eviction after COVID-19.

Ruthless for Good Fund - Equity investment in a US fund that supports companies founded by black, indigenous and people of color. Their enterprises seek to improve access and well being for historically under-invested communities.

Shiksha Finance - Equity investment in a Chennai based banking organization which grants loans to schools and middle and lower income families in India seeking to finance their children's education in an affordable private school.
Unitus Seed Fund II, LP - Partnership investment support to catalyze market based solutions in education and skill training for urban, low income families.
Unitus Seed Fund, LP - Partnership investment support to catalyze market based solutions in education and skill training for urban, low income families.
UP Fund L.P - Equity investment in India that helps to support to over 4,000 low income students enrolling in and completing high quality training courses and being placed in high demand industries.

GeneralExplanationGrp.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part XII, Line 7, Election to apply excess distributions from a prior year
GeneralExplanationGrp.MediumExplanationTxt: Pursuant to Regulation 53.4942(a)-3(c)(2)(iv), the foundation hereby elects to treat, as a current distibution out of corpus, the following unused prior years distributions that were treated as corpus distributions under Regulation 53.4942(a)-3(d)(1)(iii) in such prior tax year:Tax Year Amount2016 795,042Michael and Susan Dell Foundation (MSDF) received contributions of $795,042 during its tax year ending 12/31/2020 from the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation, a private foundation, in support of MSDF's Ed-Fi Alliance Teacher Prep Data Model project. Pursuant to Regulation 53.4942(a)-3(c)(2)(iv), MSDF elects to treat, as a currentdistribution out of corpus, $795,042 of excess 2016 qualifying distributions that were treated as distributions out of corpus in such prior tax year to satisfy the requirements imposed by Section 4942(g)(3).
